name: Eric Wustrow
content: Eric Wustrow Eric Wustrow About Publications Teaching Projects CV Contact Hello, World I'm an Associate Professor at the University of Colorado Boulder in the ECEE department. Research My research interest is broadly in the area of computer security, with a specific focus on network security. In particular, my research spans anticensorship, protocol security, and Internet measurement. Current Students Currently, I am advising three Ph.D. students: Nicolas Ammann Jackson Sippe Gaukas Wang Previous Ph.D. students Abdulrahman Alaraj Jack Wampler Sergey Frolov Ian Martiny Teaching I am currently teaching ECEN 2350: Digital Logic. Previously at Colorado, I have also taught: ECEN 4133: Introduction to Computer Security (Fall 2023, Fall 2022, Fall 2021, Spring 2021, Spring 2020, Spring 2018, Spring 2017, Fall 2016) ECEN 2350: Digital Logic (Spring 2023, Spring 2022) ECEN 5033: Cryptocurrency Security (Spring 2019) ECEN 3350: Programming Digital Systems (Fall 2020, 2019, 2018) ECEN 5003: Censorship Circumvention (Fall 2017) ECEN 5014: Computer Security & Privacy (Spring 2016). Other I enjoy Flatiron scrambling, climbing, doing circus things, playing bluegrass music, and biking.
